data.title: A Tour of 'Once Upon a Time's' Filming Locations
data.meta_description: Check out this handy guide to ABC's 'Once Upon a Time' and its filming locations across the Greater Vancouver area in British Columbia.
data.text:
Steveston is a historic village in Richmond, which is south of downtown Vancouver and part of the Greater Vancouver area. Along its main street (Moncton Street), there are many buildings used for interior and exterior shots, such as Granny’s Diner and the library. Steveston’s waterfront is also visible in many scenes. Here’s a tour of “Storybrooke, Maine.”

Steveston, Richmond, BC, Canada

A location used in a lot of scenes, Granny’s Diner is actually filmed in the Cannery Cafe. Apparently, the café makes an excellent breakfast when it isn’t standing in for Granny’s Diner.

Steveston Cannery Cafe, 3611 Moncton Street, Richmond, BC, Canada, +1 604 272 1222

Primarily used as the local library, this building is viewed quite a lot during Once Upon a Time. However, the production team has also displayed a CGI clock on the building’s front, turning it into a clock tower for some important scenes. The building used to be owned by Nikka Industries and was a fishing and marine supply shop, but the business is now closed.

Nikka Industries, 3551 Moncton Street, Richmond, BC, Canada

Steveston’s waterfront wharf area and, in particular, Third Avenue Pier are used in many scenes, especially ones featuring Hook and his beloved ship, the Jolly Roger. A lot of contemplative moments happen along the water as well.

Steveston Fisherman’s Wharf, Bayview Street, Richmond, BC, Canada

Another key business on Moncton Street, Mr. Gold’s Pawn Shop is the only building ABC owns. It’s used exclusively for Once Upon a Time, and the windows are boarded up in between seasons.

3480 Moncton Street, Richmond, BC, Canada

Located within North Vancouver’s remote mountain ranges, Spur 4 Bridge, and its surrounding riverside, features in various Once Upon a Time scenes, including a romantic picnic between David and Mary Margaret in the first season.

Spur 4 Bridge, North Vancouver, BC, Canada

Located southeast of Vancouver, in Langley, this community hall is Storybrooke’s Town Hall, and its exterior shows up in many Once Upon a Time episodes.

Fort Langley Community Hall, 9167 Glover Road, Langley, BC, Canada, +1 604 897 5155

No, not that Central Park. Located in Burnaby, which is next door to Vancouver, this Central Park is a filming location for many Vancouver-based TV shows. It’s been used on Once Upon a Time throughout the series, including more recent episodes with Frankenstein and the Doctor.

Central Park, Burnaby, BC, Canada, +1 604 294 7450
